column5: Looking for some info for Walleye, Pike and Small mouth spots. Water temp is 70. We found some small mouth and small Pike but the walleye have been elusive. We usually fish earlier before they move off the shallows. What depth and structure should I be looking at?Thanks in advance
Are you staying at Duck Bay Lodge ?

I've always felt the inside bay at the camp would be loaded with spawning crappie this time of year. Judging by a few years back, I think a travel up to Burrow Bay or farther, Obabikon Bay/Lake would result in good luck. Bill

Walleye are pretty scattered right now. Post spawn staging, and feeding heavily on mayflies already. That heat wave kind of screwed up some normal timelines. Anyhow: try some channels and bottoms of reefs. The guys have been catching them from 8' all the way down to 30'.
